imprint.text:
52°North GmbH is responsible for this website.

52°North Initiative for Geospatial Open Source Software GmbH
Martin-Luther-King-Weg 24
48155 Muenster, Germany

start.request: When you start this guide, the the current state will be reset.

step1.text: This tour gives in a few steps an overview how to use this client. First we add a timeseries from the map.

step2.text: Here we switch the view to get a map.

step3.text: This is the map view. In the map you can see markers or markergroups.

step4.text: Here you can select another timeseries provider.

step5.text: And here you can locate your device on the map.

step6.text: Here you can select a timeseries out of ordered lists.

step7.text: Please select now a station on the map.

step8.text: Select this checkbox. If there is only one timeseries for this station, the checkbox is already checked. Now you can go on with the 'OK' button to load the timeseries.

step9.text: Here you see the added time series. You can delete or locate the time series or change the color.

step10.text: This is the chart of the selected time series.

step11.text: Here you can change the time extent for your selected time series.

step12.text: Here you get a table of the raw data values to your selected time series.

step13.text: The legend entries/timeseries could be saved as favorites. In this view all favorites are listed and could be maintained.

step14.text:
Well done!
This client is a product of 52°North GmbH. You can find the source code on GitHub.

group.add: The status '{0}' is added to the favorite list.
group.notSupported: The provider of an entry of the status '{0}' isn't supported and can't be loaded.

single.add: A new favorite '{0}' is added to the list.
single.notSupported: The provider of the favorite '{0}' isn't supported and can't be loaded.

import.override: Do you want to override your current favorites?

import.text: Here you can import your exported favorites. Just paste the JSON in this text field:

export.text: Here you can export your favorites. Just copy the JSON out of this textbox and save it in a file to import it later:
